attributes.action: Require publishers to display trigger warnings on title pages of books
attributes.background:
Enact legislation requiring all UK publishers to include trigger warnings on books they publish. This should include (but not be limited to):-
- sexual violence/abuse/rape
- domestic violence
- racial abuse/hatred
- denigration or abuse of people within the LGBTQI+ community
attributes.additional_details: The joy of reading is often to allow oneself to escape reality, to relax, to learn and to grow. For those who have experienced trauma (particular of a violent sexual nature) this joy is often immediately curtailed by the use of sexual violence as a story telling tool, causing distress that may otherwise have been avoided if a trigger warning were presented at the outset of the story. This is not a call for censorship but simple fair warning similar to those used on TV, films, games and music.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Ban zoos and only permit wildlife sanctuaries that protect animal species
attributes.background: Animal species should be protected, not exploited. Animals should be safe and happy in sanctuaries, not zoos. The Government should ban zoos, and only permit wildlife sanctuaries, with higher animal welfare standards. This should result in more wildlife sanctuaries, with better habitats for animals.
attributes.additional_details: Animals are exploited for money and entertainment. They should be kept safe and happy with space to roam and live as they please, not showcased in a cage. Animals need space to live and should be given that. We believe animals in some zoos are not cared for adequately, and others are simply unhappy. Animals deserve to live in environments more similar to their natural habitats. We don't like isolation, why would they?

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Work with other Governments on banning trophy hunting
attributes.background: Endangered species and other wild animals are hunted mercilessly worldwide for ‘human entertainment’. A Global Ban on trophy hunting would be a commitment to; discourage the cruel culture of hunting, the exploitation of wild animals and help protect the wild animals that exist today.
attributes.additional_details: Sir David Attenborough revealed-currently, wild animals account for only 4% of the world’s Biomass! The decimation and exploitation of the natural world continues. Merciless trophy hunting involves the brutal killing of wild and endangered species of animals for fun! Queen Mary Uni London (2017) ’Trophy hunting and other activities involving the targeting of high-quality male animals (5% only),can cause the extinction of certain species, when faced with changing environmental conditions. The UK Government should work with other Governments around the world to ban this now.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase required teaching on climate change in the national curriculum
attributes.background: We want the Government to require 33 hours of climate education each school year, woven through all subjects on our national curriculum. This should help people better understand, adapt to and address the impact of climate change, from an early age.
attributes.additional_details:
The Peoples' Climate Vote found that 64% of people believe we are in a climate emergency. More action is needed. Part of the UN's Sustainable Development Goal for education is that all learners acquire the knowledge and skills needed to promote sustainable development.
 
We are making progress by introducing a Natural History GCSE, however providing a solid grounding in environmental awareness from age 4-18 is essential to educate and empower young people to take effective action. We must invest in further climate education to help meet the UKs net zero goals.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Set up a National Nature Service to tackle the climate and unemployment crisis
attributes.background: With Government at all levels of the UK recently declaring ecological and climate emergencies and with the Covid-19 pandemic now expected to increase unemployment to levels not seen in a generation. I believe the time is right for a Government funded employment and training National Nature Service.
attributes.additional_details:
Create a well funded employment programme offering living wage levels for quality training, education and work in conservation. It is vital that people of all ages must be given the option to join the service and are not forced. 
The Service would work in partnership with conservation NGO's, Government Agencies and National Park Authorities.
Report after report bear witness to the destruction of the UK's natural world and we must take action to make a green and sustainable recovery a reality.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Do not relax regulations on using genetic technologies in agriculture
attributes.background: DEFRA held a consultation about proposals to change regulations around certain forms of genetic technologies (such as gene editing). This received over 6,000 respondents, and over 85% of responses from individuals were AGAINST deregulation. DEFRA announced plans to deregulate anyway.
attributes.additional_details: The Government needs to commit to better, NOT weaker, regulations on genetic technologies and to support farmers with adopting agroecological methods that support nature. We should be investing in solutions that tackle the underlying problems in our food system, such as the reasons behind disease and pests in the first place. At a minimum, UK shoppers should be reassured and confident that products will not be produced using genetic technologies. That includes the organic market.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund the NHS to cover cost of one cycle of IVF per applicant as a minimum
attributes.background: Currently, some Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) will cover the cost of up to 3 cycles of IVF whilst others do not cover any. This turns local healthcare into a postcode lottery for anybody wanting children who is struggling or cannot conceive naturally.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government should ensure the NHS is funded to cover the cost of one cycle per applicant as a minimum.

This would make the availability of IVF the same throughout England regardless of where you live. It is a NATIONAL health service, not a local health service.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Address concerns of UCL/UL review into the quality of homes through PDR
attributes.background: There are many people living in unfit environments today due to change of use rules under Permitted Development Rights (PDR). This petition is asking for the Government to take action to ensure that such unfortunate conditions are addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, we've all been having to spend time at home. This has been a challenge for many, but hellish for those whose homes are not up to standard.

A recent study by University College London (UCL) and the University of London (UL) found that homes delivered through change of use PDR were often poorer than those delivered through a full planning permission in terms of delivery of space standards, adequacy of natural light, and access to amenity space, to name a few.

The Government should take action to ensure that homes delivered under change of use PDR are of a comparable standard to those delivered through full planning permission.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Fund a national forest in remembrance of lives lost to the covid 19 virus.
attributes.background: Many UK citizens are personally touched by the loss of life due to covid 19, many of whom have been unable to grieve e.g. attend a funeral, or say farewell to a loved one. Many are left alone dealing with an intangible loss and no support. A tree signifies life/regrowth and is a living tribute.
attributes.additional_details: Planting a forest is a positive action both in terms of improving our environment and creating a landscape through which citizens can walk and exercise. We could create a national forest or localised woodlands as spaces of remembrance and hope. We need something tangible to pay tribute to lost lives - so victims are never forgotten. And the forest/woodland could be used as a platform to educate citizens about habits to maintain good health in the future and how to respect nature.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make spiking by injection a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: We believe current offences used to prosecute people spiking individuals by injection are not adequate, and this should be made a specific criminal offence, with penalties reflecting the premeditate nature of the act, which has the potential to leave the victim defenceless, and endanger their life.
attributes.additional_details: A specific criminal offence with a lengthy minimum jail term should as a deterrent, and help protect people from this heinous crime.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Make people who recently recovered from Covid-19 exempt from self-isolation
attributes.background: The government should consider including people who have recovered from natural infection (as proven by a recent PCR test or antibody test) on the list of exemptions for NHS Test and Trace self-isolation when they were in contact with a person who tested positive.
attributes.additional_details:
People with a positive PCR test within the last 180 days are now eligible for the NHS Covid pass which recognises their immunity status allowing them to travel throughout Europe and enter events in the same way as double-vaccinated people.

However, when it comes to the NHS Test and Trace, people with natural immunity due to recovery from infection within the last 6 months are still required to self-isolate if they were in contact with someone who tested positive, even if they don't have symptoms and can show a negative PCR test. This needs to be updated in line with the current scientific evidence regarding immunity gained after natural infection with Covid-19.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban all fishing in UK waters, except rod and line, for 5 years.
attributes.background: Recognise the importance of life in our oceans as critical to our own survival on land. Defend our natural environment and thus society, from collapse. Ban all net fishing vessels from UK waters. Furlough fisherman. Review fishing and labelling standards. Finance independent surveys on fish stocks.
attributes.additional_details:
We need drastic change now, supported by the Government and the Navy, to protect UK waters from all commercial fishing and pollution. Maybe even ban fish from being sold in the UK for 5 years too. We need to protect all ocean life to ensure the future survival of all species, which includes humans. 

The time for drastic action is now. The consequences of inaction will be absolute.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase penalties for criminals convicted for dog fighting.
attributes.background: I don’t think torturing, injuring or being responsible for the death of a dog should only result in only up to 51 weeks’ imprisonment, a fine, or both. At the moment the penalty is minimal when considering the barbaric nature of the crime, I want the penalty to match the horrific offence.
attributes.additional_details: Dog fighting was outlawed nearly 200 years ago sadly it still continues in the 21st century and is a significant animal welfare issue for the UK. It was thought this used to be a issue occurring in the country but there has been a huge rise in incidents within cities and the cruelty is increasing. At the moment the penalty is minimal when considering the barbaric nature of the crime, I want the penalty to match the horrific offence.

departments.name: Ministry of Justice

attributes.action: Trees planted in the grounds of every new home and to be maintained by law
attributes.background: Each new home is to have a young UK species tree, planted within its grounds and be legally protected for the duration of the properties life span. This would create an industry of tree growers, reduce co2 emissions  and promote UK tree plantation.
attributes.additional_details: We are struggling to reduce carbon emissions and require soical initiatives to help address this growing problem, while creating awareness and better mental health. We need to create low cost natural carbon storage while improving residential areas and improving air quality. This method of CO2 reduction would have secondary benefits of reducing rain water runoff by tree absorption and natural shading reducing solar heat gains.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Provide all special needs schools with a RT-LAMP covid test.
attributes.background: I would like the government to provide a RT-LAMP (loop-mediated iosthermal amplification) covid-19 test to all special needs settings around the UK. For children who are unable, due to the nature of their disability, to take the PCR test.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to provide the test as the majority of children in special needs schools are unable, due to the nature of their disabilty, to take a PCR test. The RT-LAMP test is saliva based and therefore easier for those with disabilties to complete. School policies, following government guidelines, are that a child showing 1 or more covid-19 symptoms needs to self isolate for 10 days, or have a negative PCR test. As some children can't do the PCR test, they are forced to self isolate.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban breeding dogs whose snouts are so short they struggle to breathe
attributes.background: I want the government to ban the breeding & sale of dogs who have been bred with such short snouts that they can have serious difficulty in breathing. It is not natural for the dog & is extremely distressing when it is struggling for breath.
attributes.additional_details: These dogs such as Pugs & the British Bulldog have become so deformed over the years for the flat faced look that many are now seriously unfit & struggle to breathe. A dog should have a snout long enough to allow it to breathe comfortably. We say we are animal lovers & yet we do this hideous thing to dogs just because we like the look & we don't take the dog's health into consideration.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund an awareness campaign to normalise breastfeeding
attributes.background:
As a breastfeeding mother, I have faced unwanted, negative comments from others about breastfeeding, in particular, the sharing of my breastfeeding photos on social media.
 
I feel strongly that this is discrimination against something which is such a positive and natural thing to do.
attributes.additional_details: The law protects a women’s right to breastfeed in public and against discrimination from employers but many women can still be put off by these unwanted comments. The Government should launch an awareness campaign to support these women and educate the wider public about breastfeeding. Feeding our children should be looked upon as normal and positive.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban all extraction of peat for horticulture by 2022.
attributes.background: The protection of our peatlands is essential in combatting climate and ecological breakdown.  A wet, pristine peat bog soaks up CO2, whereas damaged peatlands have become a significant net source of greenhouse gases, emitting over 20 million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents (CO2e) each year.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have committed £640m through the Nature for Climate Fund to restore 35,000 hectares of England's peatland by 2025.

DEFRA "We will also phase out the use of peat in horticulture in England by 2030, and have been clear that we will consider further measures to end the use of peat once and for all."

It seems incongruous to be depleting the peatlands whilst also dedicating to restore them. A healthy garden has no need for the use of peat, and we implore the government to act faster.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund fruit trees for public parks and green spaces
attributes.background: The Government should fund schemes to plant edible fruit trees in public green spaces and parks. This would help those who are struggling for food to eat something even if it is just a piece of fruit.
attributes.additional_details: Following the cost of living crisis, it makes logical sense to help tackle this with the introduction of fruit trees in parks such as apple trees. Not only is this good for the environment but will also help tackle the shortage of food and provide the public with a form of natural food.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Do not give consent to the Rampion2 windfarm extension off the coast of Sussex
attributes.background: Energy companies should be encouraged to invest in windfarms out of sight of land such as the North Sea, enabling connection with the existing offshore grid network and keeping the impact to a minimum. Here stronger and more consistent winds should result in higher efficiencies than in the Channel.
attributes.additional_details: We believe the proposal to install up to 116 wind turbines in Sussex Bay stretching from Worthing to Selsey will blight the entire horizon along this area of outstanding natural beauty. The turbines will be as tall as 325m, 2.35 times the height of Rampion1 turbines, and higher than any hill in West Sussex. Sited only 8 miles from the shoreline, this proposal will be much nearer land than most offshore windfarms and will impact hard on local communities, the environment and the economy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund free solar panels for all homes
attributes.background: The Government should fund the installation of solar panels for all existing homes and require solar panels to be installed on all new-build homes within 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
This would significantly contribute to phasing out the use of fossil fuels and allow the UK to take a global lead in fighting climate change.
 
Combating climate change takes steps, and converting our energy uses and harnessing the best natural renewable energy is one of them.
We are already on our way to switching to electric vehicles, we are opening our eyes to the effect we have on the planet.
Let’s live in a clean, renewable country and take a global lead in combating climate change immediately.
We need to act decisively if we want to preserve our way of life, and to protect the animals that are innocent in all of this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban non-recyclable wrapping paper
attributes.background: The Government should ban wrapping paper which cannot be recycled through normal paper recycling routes in all collection areas. This is a particular issue at Christmas, when a huge amount of non-recyclable wrapping paper is bought and then thrown away.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year on average every household in the UK uses 4 rolls, which is 227,000 miles of wrapping paper. Due its shiny nature much of this cannot be recycled, and an estimated 83km2 gets put into landfill. This area would wrap Big Ben / Elizabeth Tower 260,000 times. This can easily be stopped.
 
Several years ago there was a campaign to decrease the plastic packaging in Easter eggs and this was highly successful. Let’s make this Christmas more recyclable than ever!

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Support small manufacturers through COVID-19 with loans and business rate relief
attributes.background: The Government should suspend business rates for small manufactures, as it has done with other industries, and make loans available immediately with minimal obstacles to obtaining support.
attributes.additional_details:
This will help small manufacturers who are one of the biggest employers in the country keep their staff and ensure that their businesses do not go into liquidation. Suspension of business rates is very important alongside loans to support companies whose workforce cannot attend work during this period due to the nature of the manual work they do.
 
Loans alone will leave the company in debt which may well only end in liquidation later, this needs to be avoided at all costs.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum temperature to be maintained in school classrooms
attributes.background: I would like the government to set a minimum temperature students have to endure in a classroom. Guidance for full opening of schools specifies keeping windows open to allow air to flow naturally because of COVID-19. This has meant classrooms have been getting very cold.
attributes.additional_details: The guidance states all windows in classrooms should be left open to help the natural flow of air and prevent the spread of the virus. The classrooms get far too cold and this means students can't focus and could result in illness from sustained periods of sitting in a cold room for over an hour. Students are currently wearing multiple jumpers and coats in lessons because of the conditions enforced by COVID-19.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Stop proposed investment zones
attributes.background:
The Government needs to cancel all plans to create investment zones as part of its "growth plan".
 
There are fears that these investment zones will be an "attack on nature".
attributes.additional_details:
Part of the plans for these zones is that they will bring forward additional development, including a mix of both commercial and residential development, and there are fears this will involve development of land that is part of AONBs, national parks and other green belt land.
 
These investment zones could reduce requirements for new developments, and so lead to additional development of, and adverse environmental effects on, the countryside.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Lower the age a stillborn baby can legally be registered, to 16 weeks old.
attributes.background:
A baby has to be 24+ weeks in order to be registered.

Many babies born before 24 weeks, survive. Those that don't, never legally exist.

My first baby passed away at 23 weeks and 5 days. 

I was told, "he is a still born, but legally he is considered a late-term miscarriage."
attributes.additional_details:
When you think of a baby in utero, your mind often imagines how a baby looks at 12 weeks. My baby was healthy, had perfect proportions and would have fought strong if he had the chance. 

Despite him being considered a "late-term miscarriage," I was still required to give birth to him naturally. 

It is devastating to give birth (in anyway), to a baby who's cry you'll never here. To then be told he is not legally considered a human being, only a statistic.

Help us recognise our babies lives.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Require naturism events to be only open to adults.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to prevent naturism events being accessible to people under 18.
attributes.additional_details: Naturism should be for adults only and therefore events should be licenced to be for people aged 18 years and over.  We should be safeguarding our children.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Reverse fracking moratorium and provide support for natural gas extraction
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the UK Government to:
 
- Remove the 2019 moratorium on fracking
- Identify suitable sites for fracking
- Provide support for natural gas extraction, for supply to the UK market
attributes.additional_details:
Natural Gas prices fluctuate around the world based on supply and demand. Gas costs could be significantly cheaper in the UK if it was produced in greater volume here (as in the USA).
 
We now need to seize the benefits of home grown gas to reduce the financial burden on our citizens.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Mandatory education and guidance on ethnic hair
attributes.background:
Compulsory education on the differences between human hair in the National curriculum and guidance for employers is needed.

Discrimination is most likely due to lack of knowledge and ignorance towards the variety in human beings.

Acknowledgement of the nature of afro Caribbean hair would help!
attributes.additional_details:
Introduce extensive and informative modules on afro Caribbean hair in schools.
 
In the workplace training is needed on discrimination against black people as well as information regarding the nature of hair in all its varieties. Overall resulting in the understanding that there are different types of hair that act in different ways.
 
We cannot make excuses for our ignorance any longer.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Ban the production, sale and use of disposal BBQs
attributes.background: The government should ban the production, sale and use of disposable barbeques to prevent gorse fires which happen regularly throughout the spring and summer. Huge destruction is caused to nature and wildlife, and the fire services are stretched, putting lives in danger.
attributes.additional_details: With gorse fires a regular occurance, likely from the carelessness caused by members of the public, the risk to nature and the environment is irreplaceable. Disposal barbecues should be banned to prevent gorse fires from happening and destroying vast AONB like the Mourne Mountains. This is one example of destruction caused by a gorse fire. This has caused irreplaceable damage to the environment and puts the lives of people at risk due to the resources needed to manage these fires.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the manufacture of all products containing plastic in the UK
attributes.background: I want the Government to make the UK a no-go zone for the production of ethylene, plastic pellets or any other plastic products.
attributes.additional_details: I need the Government to do this because it requires a major change in our society. People need to be convinced by having scientific and other green technologies back the change. Biodegradable products made out of natural materials would need to be more widely used. This could result in different products being grown and harvested to make them. To support people working in these industries who might be put out of a job, I would expect the Government to ensure that transition training is provided to help these people secure green jobs.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Exempt people who recover from COVID19 (with antibodies) from the vaccine
attributes.background: Make the vaccine a choice for people working in health care. Respect the research principles and ethics. Do not dismiss the side effects of the vaccine that are unknown. The unvaccinated could act as a comparison group to validate the effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccine.
attributes.additional_details: Immunology research and studies are ongoing but existing research suggests that people who gain natural immunity/antibodies to some viruses are protected against future re-infections. The antibodies tests can be carried out to confirm if the antibodies are still present and would be able to determine if an effective vaccination is required to boost the body’s natural immune response. The research on Covid-19 virus is still unravelling.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: National holiday of remembrance of those who died during the virus covid-19
attributes.background: One day in the year when all organisations close except essential services. Those working in essential services to receive double time.
attributes.additional_details: The day is to  1) Remember those who past away during Covid-19 2020  2) Educate and train people so they are made aware or never forget the virus and in the future are prepared so a pandemic can be stopped in its tracks.  3) Allow the eco system to recover and renew itself, people can appreciate fresh air and nature. Hopefully the holiday will spread world wide just like the virus and bring the world together just for one day

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: End pilot scheme of electronically tagging asylum-seeking people
attributes.background: The Government should recognise the inhumane nature of tagging asylum seekers, and end this pilot now. We believe tagging people, many of whom may be vulnerable, is unjust, and shows contempt for those seeking refuge.
attributes.additional_details:
As stated in a published policy paper, the Home Office intend to use electronic tags to monitor the whereabouts of certain people seeking asylum in England.
 
The plan treats asylum-seekers like criminals, and could be detrimental to the mental health of people who may already be vulnerable and have escaped persecution and violence elsewhere in the world. The Government must end this pilot now.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Ban the use of stickers on fruit and vegetables sold in shops and supermarkets.
attributes.background: In one survey, out of 2600 respondents, 94% agreed the stickers are wasteful. Ban these fruit/vegetable stickers. One alternative to sticker use is laser printing. We could follow what Sweden started in 2017, laser printing barcodes onto its avocados and sweet potatoes. This doesn’t damage the food.
attributes.additional_details: These stickers are removed immediately and they find their way to landfill. The fruit has its own packaging as provided by Mother Nature, it is not necessary to have these stickers which turn a healthy snack into an environmental hazard? The stickers are usually created out of a thin layer of plastic, such as vinyl. There have been several ideas to replace this kind of branding, like using edible barcodes on the fruits. We must discourage the use of plastic in every way we possibly can.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Reforest England - Use unproductive rural areas and expand existing woodland.
attributes.background:
‘Reforest’ initiative to significantly increase woodland and forest areas making use of unproductive or uneconomical farmland. 
Use CPO powers to acquire land for public use.
Woodland Trust and Forestry Commission to identify areas, guide acquisitions and subsequently manage environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Woodland and forest covers approximately 10% of England. We need to restore our forests and natural habitats significantly by securing, planting and protecting new woodland areas. 
Encourage greater access and understanding by the general public. 
Farmland in less productive areas is cheap and easy to acquire. 
Farmers are the logical custodians of the such areas supporting established trust organisations. 
Objective to increase the extent and diversity of our woodland by 100% every 5 years.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Do not require Attorney General consent for international law prosecutions
attributes.background: In international crimes Parliament legislated that the consent of the Attorney General is required before a criminal prosecution may be initiated. This breaches principles of natural justice; separation of power and denies Victims justice in indicting members of HM Government for inter. crimes.
attributes.additional_details: In 2003 the Met wrote to a potential prosecutor that the Attorney General had advised the Met that they will never grant consent to initiate criminal proceedings against any member of HM Government. In the years since 2003 several applications were made to the Attorney General for consent to initiate criminal proceedings under the Geneva Conventions Act 1957 and the ICC Act 2001 but none was granted. Legislation as it stands denies justice to Victims of crimes committed by members of HM Govern.

departments.name: Attorney General's Office

attributes.action: Make lateral flow test results a mandatory requirement for entry to venues
attributes.background: Have a uniform policy on a mandatory requirement for people to present a negative lateral flow test as condition of entry into major venues and nightclubs with sizeable attendances where social distancing is not possible due to the nature of the event i.e. nightclubs, bars, stadiums, and arenas.
attributes.additional_details: The choice to make lateral flows requirement or a recommendation has been delegated to local councils, so there is no national policy. Therefore, some venues have made it a requirement and some a recommendation. In the past 2 weeks with non-socially distanced events taking place, significant clusters of groups attending events have caught COVID as tests were not mandatory and many people went without checking if they have COVID or not. This should significantly reduce number the number of cases.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban the burning of peatlands in the fight against climate change.
attributes.background: The UK’s peatlands store more than 3000 million tons of carbon. Burning peatlands for grouse shooting releases CO2 into the atmosphere adding to the climate crisis and further degrading this important habitat making it less capable of further carbon capture.
attributes.additional_details: By banning the burning of peatlands not only is CO2 not being released into the atmosphere from fires but the habitat is able to recover and become a more powerful, natural carbon sink. Peatlands also support a range of native species so their protection increases biodiversity.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to list an expected salary on job advertisements.
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for job advertisements to display the role's expected salary (or salary range) in Pound Sterling, and/ or in the currency of the vacancies geographical location.
attributes.additional_details:
Not displaying a vacancies expected salary:
- Wastes job seekers time
- Adds to the stress of job seeking
- Increases the possibility of discriminative pay, as it facilitates paying one employee more than another, for a discriminatory reason, without the employees knowledge
- Salary Negotiable can discriminate against some people with disabilities due to the confrontation of having to negotiate for their salary. Especially for anyone with speech impediments, anxiety, or just introverted in nature.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a ‘Day of Rest’ in each calendar week as we come out lockdown.
attributes.background: The lockdown has proved that we as a nation can not only survive but also thrive when we’re forced to Slow down and bring about a natural pause or stop in our busy lives. The environment and wild animal species have been allowed in many respects to return to ‘their normal’ as pollution levels drop.
attributes.additional_details:
To return to having a day of rest where planes, trains and transport systems were halted for 24hrs, where businesses and schools  re charged through ‘stopping’ and allowed employees and pupils to rejuvenate or work from home.
Carbon emissions targets would surely be more obtainable.
This doesn’t have to be based on the old model of a religious day of rest, but of course those who wish to return to still contemplation and prayer could do so. It would be more powerful as an international movement.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Ensure that adequate shelter is provided for animals kept outside
attributes.background: To make it a legal requirement that all animals kept outside (farmed and domestic) are provided with adequate shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Many animals are kept outside in extreme weather conditions.  For instance, sheep are often kept in large open fields without access to any kind of shelter, including trees or hedgerows.  With increasing extreme weather conditions due to climate collapse animals should have access to shelter from the cold and the heat.  All animals will naturally seek shelter from extreme temperatures.  Shelter could take the form of a physical shelter or tree cover.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund free or discounted menstrual products
attributes.background: There isn't a reason that people should pay for these products, except greedy corporations wanting more money. Periods are natural, nobody asks to have them.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should fund free products, or at least provide funding to greatly reduce the price of these products.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban wood and garden waste burning.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to ban the burning of wood and garden waste in residential areas. We want to enjoy clean air in the summer and wintertime.
attributes.additional_details:
Wood burning is the largest contributor to wintertime pollution (Particulate matter pollution - PM2.5) and an increase in PM2.5 levels can result in increases death rates as the quality of the air is made worse.

We need to change our attitudes towards wood burning. We cannot afford to regard the smell of wood smoke as something evocative, nostalgic, or natural. Science is not subject to debate, burning wood and garden waste is shortening lives.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Exclude plant-based materials from the plastic tax
attributes.background:
The UK is quite sensibly looking at the impact of petrol-based plastics & the impact it has on the environment so we welcome the future plastic tax the Government has planned for 2022
We are amazed to find that the solution, make them from plants not petrol, is not excluded from the tax.
attributes.additional_details:
The current Government response is that in order for companies like ours to avoid the tax, we need to add 30% recycled plastics but for very obvious reasons, this is not an answer.

While the rest of the world realises that we don't need to change how we live, just give the consumer a natural alternative, the UK is rushing ahead with a policy that is at odds with the intention of minimising the amount of petrol-based plastics.

We want the Government to reconsider it's current approach

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Reform laws and practices regarding the removal of judges from office
attributes.background: The law relating to a judge holding office during good behaviour only was introduced in 1701 but has never been used in the jurisdiction of England and Wales. Records confirm that at no stage during the last 319 years has the law ever been needed to remove a judge on the grounds of bad behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
The fundamental rule of natural justice is that a disciplinary authority should be impartial and free from bias. The only person authorised to recommend the removal of a court judge from office is the Lord Chancellor. That does not guarantee impartiality or protect against bias.

The Government should reform the laws for removing judges and establish a new system whereby complaints against judges, and decisions about removing a judge from office, are considered and made by a public jury.

departments.name: Ministry of Justice

attributes.action: Hold COBR meetings to address the climate emergency
attributes.background: The House of Commons declared a climate emergency. COBR meetings must be held to deal with the national crisis and catastrophic disruption it will bring for people, nature, society, and environment. Action is needed now to deal with the crisis to stop fossil fuels and protect/restore nature.
attributes.additional_details: Greenhouse gases are pouring into the atmosphere at catastrophic rates and action is needed now. Current ambition is not enough. We depend on nature, but are destroying it at an alarming rate and it is in crisis. Pollution is engulfing the planet, but polluters are not paying for destruction. Current Committees are not acting at sufficient pace, or influencing action as an emergency! New plans with innovators, entrepreneurs, financiers, environmentalists, are needed to transform to a circular economy.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Seek to improve the safety and ecological-soundness of pesticide use globally
attributes.background: I would like the Government to work internationally to seek to reduce and remedy use of harmful pesticides globally. Some pesticides can be bad for our health, the environment and economy - they affect wildlife and cause health issues. The UK and its partners can start to improve practices.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should work with other countries to put pesticide use on an ecological footing. This should include influence through trade deals, to agree world standards to create a healthier and more sustainable economy. Some pesticides increase the risks of cancers and foetal abnormalities. Crop pollinating is worth up to $600 billion globally and insects are important to our gardens and natural spaces. Our human needs are met by natural resources. We need others to accept this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic gloves at petrol stations
attributes.background: Plastic gloves, used in petrol stations, end up in bushes, trees, fields. They can reach rivers, lakes and oceans. Banning their use at petrol stations should help reduce harm to the environment.
attributes.additional_details: These plastic gloves are strewn over our green belt and protected nature reserve areas. They can be extremely dangerous to plants, animals and insects & end up in water ways and ultimately breakdown and can enter the human food chain. These plastics can be incredibly hard to collect as they blow around.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: For the british government to financially help British nationals stuck abroad
attributes.background: To put in place a monthly financial packages to help British nationals who become stuck or trapped abroad in a foreign country due to unforseen circumstances which helps them sustain and maintain their basic living needs
attributes.additional_details: This is because there is no financial help given to British nationals stuck abroad who get caught up in difficulties and unforseen circumstances due to pandemics, natural disasters, terrorism etc
